message_1: What is the result of applying the linear logic rule of "contraction" to the following formula: A ⊗ B ⊗ A ⊸ C?
message_2:
In linear logic, the contraction rule allows you to combine two instances of the same proposition into one. Applying the contraction rule to the formula A ⊗ B ⊗ A ⊸ C, we can combine the two instances of A:

(A ⊗ A) ⊗ B ⊸ C

After applying the contraction rule, the resulting formula is:

A ⊗ B ⊸ C
